page.title: 05ECOLOGY, EDUCATION
page.content: As the area is largely clays with a high water table (saturated clays become an impervious rock) it is used mainly for pastural purposes. The higher wetter lands are rough grazing moors. The steeper (not easily controlled by the agricultuural tractor) lands, especially the north facing slopes, are forested. Apart from the Forestry Commission's Longmoor Woods, the other 25 copse or woods are mixed-woods. Walkers about the area, and drivers too, are soon aware of the individual buzzards habitats. Albeit deer, foxes, badgers,pheasants, partridges and the like, their habitats are not so easy to detect although they are seen, and, indeed, known to some. {EDUCATION} The children of the area attend Chulmleigh Primary School, at present in parish church premises with
